thread.title: New Poll Shows Voters Opposed To Clinton’s NYC Mayoral Bid
thread.title_full: New Poll Shows Voters Opposed To Clinton’s NYC Mayoral Bid

author: Jack Davis
title: New Poll Shows Voters Opposed To Clinton’s NYC Mayoral Bid
text:
Hillary On What She Would Change About Her Campaign: ‘I’d Win’ 
A new Rasmussen poll showed that 58 percent of likely voters do not want Clinton to run for mayor in this fall’s election. Only 23 percent of voters think the former presidential candidate, who at one point represented New York State in the US. Senate, should run again. 
Mayor Bill de Blasio, a liberal Democrat, has signaled his intention to run. He will be opposed by Republican challenger Paul Massey, Jr. "Hillary for Mayor" signs popping up in NYC. pic.twitter.com/jozK9pySld 
— Michael Arria (@michaelarria) February 28, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below 
Although signs promoting Clinton’s candidacy are now popping up across New York City, Clinton has never officially declared herself anything more than interested in the concept of a campaign, and then only if de Blasio does not run. 
However, efforts to either draft Clinton or promote her candidacy are rife across New York, and there have been a stream of comments to suggest Clinton is taking more than a passing look at the contest. 
âI spoke to her about it, but she didnât indicate or signal to me. She didnât say never, she didnât say no. In my personal opinion, itâs 50-50,â Â billionaire businessman John Catsimatidis said in January. 
Some took to Twitter to comment on Clinton’s possible candidacy. Advertisement - story continues below
